description.narrative: Older people have been particularly hard hit by the current, enduring economic downturn which is characterised by above average food price inflation, fuel price instability and the complexities of providers' tariff structures. Older people are finding it particularly hard to manage the eroding value of their money and the majority cannot take advantage of the savings made possible online because they are not IT literate. Age Concern Liverpool and two of the city's CABs will provide financial advice and support to at least 1,000 older people each year, and will offer access to computers and the Internet together with training to help them increase their income and manage money better. The grant will pay towards the costs of four part-time workers to co-ordinate these services.
